Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Parkway Pantai" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(February 2018)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Parkway Pantai, Ltd.** is a [medical](/wiki/Medical) company based in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and is [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia)'s largest private [healthcare](/wiki/Healthcare) provider, and one of the largest in [Asia](/wiki/Asia). It is a wholly owned subsidiary of [Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur)-based [IHH Healthcare](/wiki/IHH_Healthcare), whose largest shareholder is Malaysian state investment agency [Khazanah Nasional](/wiki/Khazanah_Nasional). Parkway Pantai operates private hospitals in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei), [China](/wiki/China), [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), [India](/wiki/India), [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam) and the [United Arab Emirates](/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates). IHH Healthcare also owns the [International Medical University](/wiki/International_Medical_University). In July 2017, According to the reports, Parkway Pantai issued a US$2 billion multicurrency bond to refinance its debts. ## Background Parkway Pantai owns a network of 21 hospitals, including four private [hospitals in Singapore](/wiki/Hospitals_in_Singapore) and more than 60 medical centres, clinics, and ancillary healthcare facilities in Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, India and China. It also has a network of regional hospitals in [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), [India](/wiki/India) and [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei), including [Jerudong Park Medical Centre](/wiki/Jerudong_Park_Medical_Centre). A number of [health-tourism providers](/wiki/Health_tourism_provider) work with Parkway Pantai's hospitals to develop [medical tourism](/wiki/Medical_tourism). It has more than 4,000 licensed beds in aggregate. The Group's other healthcare network in Singapore includes Parkway Shenton Pte Ltd, one of Singapore's biggest general practices; ParkwayHealth Radiology, a leading radiology service provider; and ParkwayHealth Laboratory, a major provider of laboratory services locally. Some of Parkway's hospitals are subjected to [international healthcare accreditation](/wiki/International_healthcare_accreditation), while others are not.[*citation needed*] ### Hospitals - [Parkway East Hospital](/wiki/Parkway_East_Hospital) - [Gleneagles Hospital](/wiki/Gleneagles_Hospital) - [Mount Elizabeth Hospital](/wiki/Mount_Elizabeth_Hospital) - [Mount Elizabeth Novena Hospital](/wiki/Mount_Elizabeth_Novena_Hospital) - [Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Gleneagles_Kuala_Lumpur) - [Gleneagles Penang](/wiki/Gleneagles_Medical_Centre) - Gleneagles Kota Kinabalu - Gleneagles Medini - [Gleneagles Hong Kong](/wiki/Gleneagles_Hong_Kong_Hospital) - Pantai Hospital Ampang - Pantai Hospital Ayer Keroh - Pantai Hospital Batu Pahat - Pantai Hospital Cheras - Pantai Hospital Ipoh - Pantai Hospital Klang - Pantai Hospital Kuala Lumpur - Pantai Hospital Manjung - [Pantai Hospital Penang](/wiki/Pantai_Hospital_Penang) - Pantai Hospital Sungai Petani - Gleneagles JPMC - Gleneagles Global Health City, Chennai - Gleneagles Global Hospitals, Bengaluru - Gleneagles Global Hospitals, Hyderabad - Apollo Gleneagles Hospital - Shanghai International Medical Center ## History Parkway Holdings Limited began operating as a subsidiary of Parkway Pantai Limited in August 2010. - Official website of Parkway Pantai
